intro: Gyrostachys beckii, commonly known as the desert thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as small, hairy leaves to reduce water loss. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Gyrostachys beckii is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in harsh, desert conditions.
